NEXT GENERATION MANUFACTURING
We bring together advanced manufacturing and technology to drive digital transformation.
NGen is the industry-led, non-profit organization leading Canada’s Global Innovation Cluster for Advanced Manufacturing. One of five national networks supported by Canada's ambitious Global Innovation Clusters Initiative.

      About Us
    











What We Offer





Funding

We provide a range of funding solutions from support for industry clusters to challenge programs and industry-led Supercluster projects.






Collaboration 

In the new manufacturing economy, world-leading solutions will not be built in silos. Find what you need to lead or join a Supercluster project consortium.






Workforce

Effective business management will play an important role in creating the globally competitive companies of tomorrow. That's why we’re making investments in workforce development, management education, and more.





We are founded on the principle that digital transformation in advanced manufacturing will enrich the lives of Canadians, delivering better products and good jobs while generating the economic growth essential to a better future.

Seeteria

A Predictive AI Safety Solution for Material Handling Operations





ABOUT THE COMPANY
Elevating Forklift Safety With Predictive AI
www.seeteria.com

Industry Sector: Warehousing, Cement Manufacturing, Chemical Manufacturing, Construction, Electronics manufacturing, Food processing, Metal Manufacturing (Iron, Steel, Aluminium etc), Oil & Gas, Plastics, Textiles, Wood Product Manufacturing
Tech Area: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Big Data



PROJECT IDEA

Seeteria employs advanced AI technology to significantly enhance safety in facilities that utilize material handling vehicles, such as forklifts. Our solution analyzes CCTV footage in real time to activate forklift sirens at crucial moments, thereby aiding drivers in taking preventive actions to avoid collisions. Additionally, our system delivers real-time mobile notifications to management about high-risk activities, along with AI-generated forecasts of potential safety hazards and recommendations for mitigation actions.



Project Objectives


Reduce the frequency of struck-by events involving material handling vehicles like forklifts, tractors, reach trucks, order pickers, and heavy-duty machines like excavators and scrapers
Providing management with real-time risk notifications and dashboards containing detailed safety information. Additionally, AI-based recommendations for improving safety, workflow continuity, and reducing downtime and productivity losses
Enhance trust and cooperation among vehicle operators by alerting them only when inaction could result in an accident.




What they bring to the table

Seeteria offers advanced expertise in predictive AI and machine learning, specialized in enhancing safety around material handling vehicles in industrial and logistics environments. We bring a robust track record of successfully implementing software solutions. We are adept at collaborating with organizational employees at various levels to ensure smooth integration and operation



What they need

We are looking for partners who are passionately committed to elevating safety standards within their operations

Panevo Services Limited

AI Enabled Energy Management Information Systems





ABOUT THE COMPANY
Industrial energy and process optimization solutions
www.panevo.com

Industry Sector: Other:
Tech Area: Artificial Intelligence (AI), Digital Twins, IIoT



PROJECT IDEA

Leveraging Panevo’s proven Energy Management Information System (EMIS) software development, energy efficiency and decarbonization expertise, industrial site data will be collected to inform, refine and test AI and Reinforcement Learning EMIS functionality. This new functionality will dynamically analyze data and inform control system optimization to improve energy efficiency, reduce emissions and increase competitiveness beyond standard solutions.



Project Objectives

1) Emissions reduction & energy efficiency

Benefits to customers: Reduce operating costs, energy waste and carbon emissions.
Alignment with NGen: Reduction of greenhouse gas emissions in manufacturing facilities (expected savings range 5 - 25%), facilitate path to net-zero.

2) Digital transformation

Benefits to customers: Improved carbon footprint visibility & accuracy, energy KPI reporting and advanced loss avoidance measures.
Alignment with NGen: Tracking, managing, and reporting GHG emissions.

3) Data-driven decision making 

Benefits to customers: Leverage big data and AI to identify and eliminate sub-optimal energy and natural resource usage, while intelligently prioritizing decarbonization and energy efficiency improvement initiatives.
Alignment with NGen: Smart Manufacturing for operational efficiency gains. Innovations of advanced technology in manufacturing.

4) Establish collaborative partnership

Benefits to customers: Transformative collaboration, expert knowledge share, improved awareness, and energy performance visibility at the operational level.
Alignment with NGen: Benefits to Canada’s advanced manufacturing ecosystem, alignment with industry benchmarks and sustainability goals, facilitated commercialization and applicability to other sectors.




What they bring to the table

Expert NGen project enablement and management Meter & sensor gap analysis and implementation PM Industrial decarbonization & energy efficiency EMIS integration and machine learning development



What they need

illuming Power Inc.

Hydrogen Electrochemical Stack Component Manufacturing Innovations





ABOUT THE COMPANY
Illuming Power develops and manufactures high performing materials, components and fuel cell stacks for stationary power and transportation OEMs and their suppliers. The Company’s cost leadership in expanded graphite/resin composite bipolar plates (“BPP”) is key to ensuring customers can compete on Total Cost of Ownership (“TCO”) with current diesel power systems. Its innovation is based on trade secrets, knowhow and filed patent applications

Industry Sector: Aerospace, Automotive, Energy, Rail
Tech Area: Advanced Materials, Green Technology, Electric Vehicle technology



PROJECT IDEA

Develop, construct and commission a volume production PEM fuel cell stack assembly line utilizing Illuming Power’s expanded graphite composite plate material, advanced rapid elastomeric sealing technology, and catalyst coated membranes. The line must be flexible for runs of fuel cell, electrolyzer and other electrochemical stacks, such as Ayrton Energy’s LOHC hydrogenation and dehydrogenation stacks.



Project Objectives


Qualification of manufacturing processes tailored to Illuming Power’s fuel cell components (bipolar plates, cell sealing and catalyst coated membrane).
Qualification of manufacturing processes tailored to Ayrton Energy’s LOHC stack components.
Integration of a cost-competitive, end-to-end stack assembly line for the Company’s and Partner’s technologies.
Validation of the commercial viability of the manufacturing equipment being developed.




What they bring to the table

We bring Fuel Cell plate, seal and MEA design, material science and development, and stack prototyping experience. We have stack development and prototyping capabilities and currently produce at very low volume.



What they need

We require capable manufacturing equipment developers to design and build volume scale workcells for expanded graphite plate manufacturing, seal manufacturing, unit cell assembly and stack assembly.

Terra Bioindustries Inc.

Decarbonizing food and fermentation value chains through Upcycling spent grains





ABOUT THE COMPANY
Terra Bioindustries has developed the 2nd Generation of Upcycling to provide Food and Fermentation ingredients that decarbonize supply chains.
www.terrabioindustries.com

Industry Sector: Agrifood, Biomanufacturing
Tech Area: Agritech / AgTech, Green Technology, Biotech



PROJECT IDEA

The project aims to deliver a validation for a circular solution that decarbonizes scope 1 and 3 areas by connecting three main industry sectors within Saskatchewan: Baking, Precision fermentation and Brewing industries. This approach to be achieved by enabling Terra Bioindustries upcycling process.



Project Objectives


Demonstration of food safe collection, handling and transportation of spent grains (Brewery to Ingredient processing)
Performing patented Upcycling fractionation process from Terra Bioindustries at Food Grade Ingredient Manufacturing facility.
Integrate Upcycled ingredients in Baking and Precision fermentation applications.
Perform TEA and LCA for the overall solution to calculate the carbon reduction in scope 1 and 3 emissions.




What they bring to the table


Implementation of food safety methods
Deliver upcycling solutions using cost effective techniques like enzymatic digestion
Perform validation of food and fermentation applications for best market positioning of upcycled ingredients




What they need


Best and feasible practices at Breweries for spent grain recovery
Production scale manufacturing of baking products based on application requirements
Understanding of fermentation media requirement composition for Fermentation derived products
LCA calculation for a circular demonstration

Carbonhound

Automated Greenhouse Gas Emissions (GHG) Accounting Platform for Manufacturers





ABOUT THE COMPANY
Automated greenhouse gas emissions accounting platform to empower businesses to measure and reduce their impact with confidence and integrity.
https://carbonhound.com/

Industry Sector: Mining, Metal Manufacturing (Iron, Steel, Aluminium etc), Medical Equipment and Supplies, Food processing, Marine, Energy, Electronics manufacturing, Construction, Chemical Manufacturing, Cement Manufacturing, Biomanufacturing, Biomedical, Automotive, Agrifood, Aerospace, Oil & Gas, Nuclear, Pharmaceuticals, Plastics, Rail, Retail, Entertainment, Space, Textiles, Tooling/Metalworking, Warehousing, Wood Product Manufacturing, Defence
Tech Area: Analytics, Artificial Intelligence (AI), Cloud Computing, Green Technology, Automation



PROJECT IDEA

Leverage Carbonhound's comprehensive, third-party verified carbon accounting platform to measure your organizations' greenhouse gas emissions and the climate impact of your sustainability projects. Through automated connections to your primary sources, industry & peer benchmarking, flexible reporting options, and monthly data refreshes, Carbonhound gives manufacturers the confidence and baseline data they need to set credible reduction goals and prove the business value of sustainability.



Project Objectives


Measure & automate your Scope 1, 2, and 3 baseline GHG emissions aligned to the GHG Protocol 
Identify hotspots and set reduction targets related to sustainability initiatives and projects
Generate verification-ready reports on your organization's emissions and reduction initiatives




What they bring to the table

Carbonhound is trusted by over 100 companies to track, measure, and report their carbon emissions. The software is third-party verified against ISO 14064 and the GHG Protocol and saves up to 70% of the time & resources required when compared to a manual process or hiring external consultants. Through our Data Concierge, Carbonhound ingests source data and we have been able to automate 100% of customer requests.



What they need

We are looking for businesses who are looking to automate their emissions data to track and prove the climate impact of sustainability initiatives. We are interested in learning more about manufacturing processes that reduce emissions, data sources unique to the industry, further develop our capability to support manufacturing processes, and most importantly increase our ability to automate data ingestion.

AI Energy CoPilot Expansion: Automating Facility Asset Control for Cost and Emission Reduction





ABOUT THE COMPANY
At Edgecom Energy, we empower large energy consumers to take control of their energy costs and reduce emissions by harnessing the power of IoT and AI solutions. Our innovative technology helps you optimize energy usage, save money, and contribute to a greener, more sustainable future.
https://www.linkedin.com/company/edgecomenergy

PROJECT IDEA

We have launched an initial version of our AI Energy CoPilot and envision using this tool to automate the control of assets and processes within a facility to minimize costs and emissions in coordination with what’s happening on the grid. This project also involves further training and developing new capabilities of our CoPilot with feedback and data from employees and processes with manufacturing facilities.

Train AI Energy CoPilot on unique priorities and constraints of manufacturing facility Integrate CoPilot with existing systems (ERP, SCADA, PLCs, etc) Use CoPilot to optimize and eventually control certain facility operation considering internal and external information to reduce costs and emissions Collaborate with on-site staff to improve and expand capabilities of CoPilot

Energy management and grid analytics

Learn More About Future Ready
Canadian manufacturers are facing unprecedented challenges that require sophisticated solutions. NGen’s Future Ready project was launched to help manufacturers embrace the digital transformation and navigate labour shortages and skills gaps with practical solutions.
Future Ready consisted of: 

Transformation Leadership Program (TLP) & AmpUp Funding
In-Person Skilled Trades Events 
Tools for manufacturers including NGen’s Skills Building Zone and NextSkillsAI 
Bringing new workers into Canadian manufacturing: Wage Subsidies 
Industry research






Future Ready French Video















Future Ready Programs








Transformation Leadership Program(TLP) & AmpUp Funding 

The Transformation Leadership Program (TLP) and AmpUp Employee Training funding were built to address the skilled labour challenges in Canada’s manufacturing sector while helping manufacturers upskill existing workforces.
TLP consisted of on demand and self paced modules and assessment tools which helped manufacturers identify strategic priorities and develop plans to overcome skills gaps. TLP manufacturers then had access to federal grants to use towards employee training programs of their choice. NGen facilitated access to these grants which cover 80% the cost of employees training programs, or up to $8,000 per company.










In-Person Skilled Trades Events


 In-Person Skilled Trade Events provided newcomers to Canada with a chance to assess their readiness for the Canadian job market. 
 Newcomers received a certificate proving they participated in a government recognized program, gained experience, made connections with instructors in their trade, and received video footage of their work—valuable assets they can use in future job application











Tools for manufacturers including NGen’s Skills Building Zone and NextSkillsAI 

 NGen’s industry-led research revealed that manufacturers needed new tools to help assess their core skills and build personalized plans for training and development. In response, NGen designed accessible, online tools and resources to support manufacturers in training their workforce.These included:

 Skills Building Zone: An online catalogue of on-demand training and tools for Canadian manufacturers and workers.
 Skills for Success Assessments – Know.Me.Q: NGen partnered with Me.Q to offer four individual assessments based on the Skills for Success framework to allow Canadian manufacturing workers to self-assess their core skills.​ These provide personalized recommendations for skills development.
 NextSkillsAI: An AI tool for manufacturers to reveal the competencies and skills gaps of their workforce and develop upskilling plans to address them. NextSkillsAI included insight into the impact of technology changes, digitalization, transition to net-zero carbon and other current challenges.












Bringing new workers into Canadian manufacturing: Wage Subsidies 

NGen partnered with Canadian Skills Training & Employment Coalition (CSTEC) to place new workers across 100+ manufacturing facilities, by facilitating manufacturer’s access to wage subsidies. In total, NGen distributed $3.447 million to manufacturers in wage subsidies. $7,000 was provided in support to members of equity-deserving and groups, and $5,000 was provided to all others.
 Impact: 

 606 individuals have been supported by wage subsidies to date. 
 70% of individuals are members of equity deserving groups.
 92% of placements resulted in permanent employment.

Future Ready supported manufacturers from coast to coast, providing access to funding, tools, and programs to help overcome challenges in labour and skills shortages.

Terri-Lynn is Future Ready
Terri-Lynn's journey in the manufacturing industry is a testament to the impact of the Future Ready program is having on equity deserving communities.
As a LGBIQ+ single mother of three, she embarked on her new career at the age of 39, navigating through apprenticeships and overcoming workplace challenges, including those related to her identity and safety concerns during the pandemic. Through the wage placements provided by the Future Ready program, Terri-Lynn found a supportive environment at Promach, completed her apprenticeship, and achieved her General Machinist Journeyperson certification.
Her story is a powerful affirmation of how the Future Ready program is actively enabling diverse individuals to enter and succeed in manufacturing careers.
